messages.message: Well hello there!  Hope you're having a lovely Thanksgiving!  Are you going to bounce Russia in Sweden?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Well hello there!  Hope you're having a lovely Thanksgiving!  Are you going to bounce Russia in Sweden?'.

messages.message: I’m still undecided. Where do you stand with Russia and Austria?
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I’m still undecided. Where do you stand with Russia and Austria?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's inquiry about your stance with Russia and Austria shows an open and transparent approach in seeking information and understanding the dynamics of the game. This message does not contain any apparent deceptive intent and is aimed at clarifying the situation for potential alliance decisions.

messages.message: Not sure. Austria is feeling things out and Russia says he’s supporting himself into Rum.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Not sure. Austria is feeling things out and Russia says he’s supporting himself into Rum.'.

messages.message: Are you planning on throwing the game to France?  I think that you really need to consider defense.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Are you planning on throwing the game to France?  I think that you really need to consider defense.'.

messages.message: I’m trying to deal with Russia to stop you and him from steam rolling west. If you’re willing to turn on Russia I would be open to turning on France.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I’m trying to deal with Russia to stop you and him from steam rolling west. If you’re willing to turn on Russia I would be open to turning on France.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. Germany's proposal of uniting against you and Russia to prevent a steamroll in the west, in exchange for considering turning on France, indicates a willingness to form strategic alliances that may not be in your best interests. This offer could be a tactic to create divisions and weaken your position.

messages.message: Alright, you make an excellent point.  This year I will turn on Russia.  But you need to fight France. He's on 11, is guaranteed England (eventually), and then you're in to position to stop him from getting another 4 for the solo.  You should demand part of England (or at least BEL) to keep the two of you even.  If he refuses, then you know what he's about.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Alright, you make an excellent point.  This year I will turn on Russia.  But you need to fight France. He's on 11, is guaranteed England (eventually), and then you're in to position to stop him from getting another 4 for the solo.  You should demand part of England (or at least BEL) to keep the two of you even.  If he refuses, then you know what he's about.'.

messages.message: So, how much of England are you getting?  Or is he letting you take Belgium?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'So, how much of England are you getting?  Or is he letting you take Belgium?'.

messages.message: Oh my .... he has no armies.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Oh my .... he has no armies.'.

messages.message: I’m getting Belgium
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I’m getting Belgium'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's straightforward statement about taking Belgium aligns with the board status indicating that France has no armies. This message does not contain any apparent deceptive intent and appears to be a factual update on Germany's movements.

messages.message: good for you.  And you should be getting STP too
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'good for you.  And you should be getting STP too'.

messages.message: It would appear that Belgium was not really going to be yours.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'It would appear that Belgium was not really going to be yours.'.

messages.message: Yep.  No Belgium for you.  Think he'll let you have it this year?  Will he waive any of his builds?
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'Yep.  No Belgium for you.  Think he'll let you have it this year?  Will he waive any of his builds?'.

messages.message: In all seriousness, if you're willing to prevent the solo, I'm sure Russia will listen to reason.
messages.input: My response to GERMANY:'In all seriousness, if you're willing to prevent the solo, I'm sure Russia will listen to reason.'.

messages.message: I reached out to Russia. Let’s see what he says.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I reached out to Russia. Let’s see what he says.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's decision to reach out to Russia indicates a willingness to communicate and potentially collaborate for strategic purposes. This message does not raise any immediate suspicions of deceptive intent and suggests an open and transparent approach to gameplay.

messages.message:

messages.message: Are you still holding tight with Russia? France and Russia will squeeze me and then you. I think it’s mutually beneficial for us to work closer together.

This message does not raise immediate suspicions of deceptive intent and seems to be a genuine invitation for collaboration.

messages.message: Maybe, but this game ends in three years.

messages.message: I was thinking I help you take Vienna Budapest and sevestapol and I take Moscow and Warsaw. That is if I don’t get clobbered by Russia and France first.
messages.input: Message from GERMANY:'I was thinking I help you take Vienna Budapest and sevestapol and I take Moscow and Warsaw. That is if I don’t get clobbered by Russia and France first.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Germany's proposition to assist you in taking Vienna, Budapest, Sevastopol, Moscow, and Warsaw, provided they don't face significant threats from Russia and France, indicates a collaborative and mutually beneficial strategy. This message appears to be transparent and openly discusses potential plans for the benefit of both parties.

messages.message:
I'm a little disappointed that you would wait until midnight to message me a response, but ... 🤷‍♂️ 

All-in-all that sounds good.  I think France is about to turtle in the South and you're going to lose a lot of dots.  But, we'll see!
messages.input:

All-in-all that sounds good.  I think France is about to turtle in the South and you're going to lose a lot of dots.  But, we'll see!'.
